decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of Gates to generate mana and powerful removal spells like Journey to Nowhere. It also utilizes Counterspell to disrupt opponents' plans and Squadron Hawk to provide card advantage. The inclusion of Lórien Revealed and Outlaw Medic adds resilience and versatility to the deck, with Prismatic Strands offering protection against combat damage. The goal is to establish board control and outvalue the opponent, ultimately securing victory through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through powerful counterspells and disruptive spells while utilizing card draw and card selection to maintain tempo and card advantage. The deck aims to efficiently deal with threats while packing in powerful finishers like Cryptic Serpent and Murmuring Mystic to close out the game. It also focuses on utilizing Tolarian Terror to apply pressure and disrupt opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game's pace and dictate the flow of the match to achieve victory.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures such as Scrapwork Mutt and Lotleth Giant using cards like Satyr Wayfinder and Stinkweed Imp. Then, by utilizing cards like Dread Return and Malevolent Rumble, the player can bring back these powerful creatures from the graveyard for a game-winning combo. The deck also includes cards like Town Greeter and Generous Ent to help with mana acceleration and card draw, ensuring the player can consistently execute their reanimation strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. Utilizing creatures like Burning-Tree Emissary and Goblin Bushwhacker, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on. With cards like Rally at the Hornburg and Reckless Impulse to generate card advantage and speed up the deck, the goal is to end the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of artifact creatures and use various cards to sacrifice and generate value from them. By combining aggressive creatures with sacrifice outlets and removal spells, you can maintain a strong board presence while disrupting your opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Toxin Analysis allows you to handle graveyard strategies effectively. Overall, this deck aims to take advantage of the synergy between Affinity and Aggro strategies to come out on top in a Pauper 1 vs 1 game.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game through the use of Gates to generate mana efficiently, while also using a variety of spells such as Counterspell, Journey to Nowhere, and Prismatic Strands to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Squadron Hawk provides card advantage and helps to maintain board presence, while cards like Lórien Revealed and Thraben Charm offer additional versatility in dealing with threats. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind them down with efficient control and removal spells.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly generate artifacts and use them as resources to deal damage to the opponent, combining the aggro strategy with the affinity mechanic. By using cards like Refurbished Familiar and Drossforge Bridge to put artifacts into play quickly, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with creatures like Myr Enforcer and spell cards like Galvanic Blast. The deck also includes support cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Thoughtcast to provide additional ways to control the board and draw cards.

The deck focuses on using low-cost creatures such as Nezumi Linkbreaker and Carrion Feeder to apply early pressure on the opponent. The goal is to sacrifice creatures like Mortician Beetle and Bloodthrone Vampire to pump up other creatures and deal direct damage to the opponent. Cards like Village Rites and Rite of Consumption are used for card draw and finishing off the opponent. Overall, this deck aims to swarm the board with creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's plans and controlling the game through efficient counterspells and card draw. Utilizing cards like Tolarian Terror and Murmuring Mystic to create threats while controlling the board with Counterspell and Dispel. Its win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Cryptic Serpent and Tolarian Terror, while disrupting their strategy with effective control spells. The deck aims to out value the opponent by efficiently managing resources and controlling the tempo of the game until it can secure a decisive victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing gates to ramp and fix mana, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with removal spells and graveyard hate. The deck also aims to generate value through card draw with Squadron Hawk and filtering with Preordain. The inclusion of creatures with lifelink like Sacred Cat and Outlaw Medic provide some lifegain, while cards like Journey to Nowhere and Cast Down help deal with threats on the board. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of control elements and efficient creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering spells and utilizing powerful creatures like Cryptic Serpent and Murmuring Mystic. The goal is to outsmart the opponent with spells like Deem Inferior and Sleep of the Dead while manipulating the opponent's deck with cards like Thought Scour and Brainstorm. The deck aims to maintain board control while building up card advantage through cards like Deep Analysis and Tolarian Terror. With a heavy emphasis on countering spells and utilizing card draw, this deck aims to overpower the opponent through strategic decision-making and resource management.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and aggressively build up a board of infect creatures while utilizing pump spells to push through damage and close out the game. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures like Glistener Elf and Ichorclaw Myr, while protecting them with cards like Snakeskin Veil and Vines of Vastwood. The deck also includes cards like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa to further boost the power of its creatures and secure victories in a Pauper 1 vs 1 setting.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive Elves to overwhelm the opponent. By playing creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic early on, the deck can ramp up mana and flood the board with threats. Cards like Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help refill the hand with more Elves, while Timberwatch Elf boosts their power. The goal is to attack relentlessly, using cards like Nyxborn Hydra and Avenging Hunter to deal damage and take control of the game. Additionally, Wellwisher and Priest of Titania provide some much-needed lifegain and mana acceleration.

This mono green aggro deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence with fast, low-cost creatures like Glistener Elf and Ichorclaw Myr. By buffing these creatures with spells like Rancor and Might of Old Krosa, players can deal large amounts of damage early in the game. The deck also includes protection spells like Snakeskin Veil to keep key creatures alive. Overall, the main goal of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of powerful creatures and win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing disruptive spells and countering the opponent's moves. The deck aims to efficiently cast powerful creatures like Tolarian Terror and Cryptic Serpent while drawing cards and manipulating the top of the library with spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. With an emphasis on protecting the board with counterspells and disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Unable to Scream, the deck looks to outlast and outsmart its opponent in a battle of attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces involving Balustrade Spy and Dread Return to mill the entire library, then bring back Lotleth Giant to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck includes ramp creatures like Overgrown Battlement and Saruli Caretaker to accelerate the combo, along with card draw spells like Lead the Stampede and Winding Way to find the necessary pieces. The deck aims to win the game rapidly through a powerful and synergistic combo sequence.
